UDP-related services
[Network services (TCP/UDP sockets)]


Typedefs

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_RecvFrom_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, char *Buf, unsigned int BufferLength, IPDR_IPAddress *RemoteAddr, unsigned short *RemotePort, unsigned int *ReadBytes)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SendTo_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, const char *Buf, unsigned int BufferLength, IPDR_IPAddress RemoteAddr, unsigned short RemotePort)
typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetHostName_t )(IPDR_PlatformArg P, char *HostName, int NameLength)

Detailed Description

The UPD-related functions are used for broadcast (for the syslog facility) and for the collector (server) to do the intial protocol negotiation.

Typedef Documentation

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_GetHostName_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, char *HostName, int NameLength)
 

Get the hostname, in the form needed for syslog. The result is always null-terminated; if insufficient space is provided, the result will be truncated.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
HostName The returned host name. On Unix systems, this should be at least MAXHOSTNAMELEN long. If the call fails, this will be set to the empty string ("").
NameLength The size of the HostName array.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR otherwise (GetLastErrorMessage ought to have an indication of the problem).
See also:
IPDR_SetLogOutputAddress

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_RecvFrom_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, char *Buf, unsigned int BufferLength, IPDR_IPAddress *RemoteAddr, unsigned short *RemotePort, unsigned int *ReadBytes)
 

Read into a buffer from a UDP socket.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S Socket (created with IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t).
Buf Pointer to the buffer where the bytes will be read into.
BufLength Maximum number of bytes to read into the buffer.
Timeout Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for data (0 means wait forever); the function returns IPDR_ERR_OPERATION_WOULD_BLOCK if the timeout expires.
ReadBytes (output) How many bytes were actually read. This will be greater than zero if the return code is IPDR_OK; it will be zero for any other return code. End-of-input is treated as IPDR_ERR_COMMUNICATION_ERROR.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR_COMMUNICATION_ERROR, or IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.

typedef IPDR_Status(* IPDR_SendTo_t)(IPDR_PlatformArg P, IPDR_SocketHandle S, const char *Buf, unsigned int BufferLength, IPDR_IPAddress RemoteAddr, unsigned short RemotePort)
 

Send the contents of a buffer onto a TCP socket.

Parameters:
P The context argument when calling platform function, as passed to IPDR_InitExporter().
S Socket (created with IPDR_CreateUDPSocket_t).
Buf Pointer to the bytes to write.
BufLength The number of bytes to be written from the buffer.
Returns:
IPDR_OK on success; IPDR_ERR_COMMUNICATION_ERROR, or IPDR_STATUS_RETURN_CODE otherwise.
